intro: Pseudoxandra lucida, commonly known as the glossy pseudoxandra, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its evergreen, lance-shaped leaves that are glossy and dark green. The plant produces small, white flowers with five petals, which are typically clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
